Name: Saju Jirugi
Steps:
1. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch, Kihap!
  2. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance facing C: Left Down Block
  3. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  4. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance facing D: Left Down Block
  5. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  6. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance facing E: Left Down Block
  7. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch, Kihap!
  8. Right leg returns to Parallel Ready Stance facing B.
  9. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch, Kihap!
  10. Left leg shifts into a Right Front Stance facing E: Right Down Block
  11. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  12. Left leg shifts into a Right Front Stance facing D: Right Down Block
  13. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  14. Left shifts into a Right Front Stance facing C: Right Down Block
  15. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch, Kihap!

Name: Saju Makgi
Steps:
1. Right leg steps back into a Left Front Stance: Left Open-Hand Down Block, Kihap!
  2. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Inside Forearm Block
  3. Right leg shifts into Left Front Stance facing D: Left Open-Hand Down Block
  4. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Inside Forearm Block
  5. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance towards B: Left Open-Hand Down Block
  6. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Inside Forearm Block
  7. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance towards E: Left Open-Hand Down Block
  8. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Inside Forearm Block, Kihap!
  9. Right leg returns to Parallel Ready Stance Facing C
  10. Left leg steps back into a Right Front Stance: Right Open-Hand Down Block, Kihap!
  11. Right leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Inside Forearm Block
  12. Left leg shifts into a Right Front Stance Towards E: Right Open-Hand Down Block
  13. Right leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Inside Forearm Block
  14. Left leg shifts into a Right Front Stance towards B: Right Open-Hand Down Block
  15. Right leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Inside Forearm Block
  16. Left leg shifts into a Right Front Stance towards D: Right Open-Hand Down Block
  17. Right leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Inside Forearm Block, Kihap!

Name: Chon-Ji
Steps:
1. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing B: Left Down Block, kihap!
  2. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  3. Right leg turns into a Right Front Stance facing C: Right Down Block
  4. Left leg steps forward into Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  5. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing D: Left Middle Punch
  6. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  7. Right leg turns into a Right Front Stance facing E: Right Down Block
  8. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch, kihap!
  9. Left leg turns into Left Back Stance facing C: Left Inside Forearm Block
  10. Right leg steps forward into Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  11. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing B: Right Inside Forearm Block
  12. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  13. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing E: Left Inside Forearm Block
  14. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  15. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing D: Right Inside Forearm Block
  16. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  17. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  18. Right leg steps back into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  19. Left leg steps back into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch, kihap!

Name: Dan-Gum
Meaning: Named after the holy Dan-Gun, the legendary founder of Korea in the year 2,333 BCk
Steps:
1. Left foot turns into a Left Back Stance facing B: Double Knife-Hand Block, Kihap!
  2. Right foot steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right High Punch
  3. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing C: Right Double Knife-Hand Block
  4. Left foot steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left High Punch
  5. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance towards D: Left Down Block
  6. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right High Punch
  7. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left High Punch
  8. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right High Punch, kihap!
  9. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance towards E: Left Box Block
  10. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right High Punch
  11. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing F: Right Box Block
  12. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left High Punch
  13. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing A:Left Down Block
  14. Left Rising Block
  15. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Rising Block
  16. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Rising Block
  17. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Rising Block
  18. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing B: Left Reverse Knife-Hand Strike
  19. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right High Punch
  20. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing C: Right Reverse Knife-Hand Strike
  21. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left High Punch, Kihap!

Name: Do-San
Meaning: Do San is the pseudonym of the patriot Ahn Chang-Ho
Steps:
1. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing B: Left Middle Block, Kihap!
  2. Right Middle Punch
  3. Left leg turns into a Parallel Stance facing D, Right leg turns into a Right Front Stance facing B: Right Middle Block
  4. Left Middle Punch
  5. Left leg steps into a Left Back Stance facing C: Left Double Knife-Hand Block
  6. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Augmented Spear-Hand Strike, kihap!
  7. Pivot slightly left and rotate the palm down. Left leg turns 360° into a Left Front Stance facing D: Left Back Fist
  8. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Back Fist
  9. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing E: Left Middle Block
  10. Right Middle Punch
  11. Left Leg turns into a a Parallel Stance to A. Right leg turns into a Right Front Stance to F: Right Middle Block
  12. Left Middle Punch
  13. Left leg steps up to Right, then steps out into a Left Front Stance facing G: Wedge Block
  14. Right Front Snap Kick into a
  15. Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  16. Left Middle Punch
  17. Right leg turns into a Right Front Stance facing H: Wedge Block
  18. Left Front Snap into a
  19. Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  20. Right Middle Punch
  21. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing A: Left Rising Block
  22. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Rising Block
  23. Left leg turns into a Left Horse Stance towards B: Left Reverse Knife-Hand Strike
  24. Left leg steps up to Right, Right leg steps out into a Right Horse Stance towards C: Reverse Knife-Hand Strike, Kihap!

Name: Won-Hyo
Meaning: Wonhyo was the noted monk who introduced Buddhism to the Silla Dynasty in the year 686 AD
Steps:
1. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing B: Box Block, Kihap!
  2. Right Trapping Knife-Hand Strike
  3. Taekwondo twist into a Left Fixed Stance: Left Middle Punch
  4. Left leg steps up to right, right leg steps out into a Right Back Stance facing C: Box Block
  5. Left Trapping Knife-Hand Strike
  6. Taekwondo twist into a Right Fixed Stance: Right Middle Punch
  7. Right leg steps up to left, left leg raises into a Left Flamingo Stance facing D: Guarding Block
  8. Left Side Thrust Kick into
  9. Left Back Stance: Double Knife-Hand Block
  10. Right leg steps forward into a Right Back Stance: Double Knife-Hand Block
  11. Left leg steps forward into a Left Back Stance: Double Knife-Hand Block
  12. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Augmented Spear-Hand Strike, kihap!
  13. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing E: Box Block
  14. Right Trapping Knife-Hand Strike
  15. Taekwondo twist into a Left Fixed Stance: Left Middle Punch
  16. Left leg steps up to right, right leg steps out into a Right Back Stance facing F: Box Block
  17. Left Trapping Knife-Hand Strike
  18. Taekwondo twist into a Right Fixed Stance: Right Middle Punch
  19. Right leg steps up to left, left steps out into a Left Front Stance facing A: Right Circular Inside Forearm Block
  20. Right Front Snap Kick into
  21. Right Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  22. Left Circular Inside Forearm Block
  23. Left Front Snap Kick into
  24. Right Middle Punch
  25. Right leg rises into Right Flamingo Stance: Guarding Block
  26. Right Side Thrust Kick
  27. Right leg steps down next to left. Left turns counterclockwise into a Left Back Stance facing B: Guarding Block
  28. Left leg steps up to right, right steps out into a Left Back Stance facing C: Guarding Block, kihap!

Name: Yul-Gok
Meaning: Yul-Gok is the pseudonym of the great philosopher and scholar Yi Ee, nicknamed the “Confucius of Korea.”
Steps:
1. Left leg steps out into a Horse Stance on line BC: Left Arm Extension, Kihap!
  2. Right Middle Punch
  3. Left Middle Punch
  4. Left leg steps up to right, right steps out into a Horse Stance on line BC: Right Arm Extension
  5. Left Middle Punch
  6. Right Middle Punch
  7. Right leg turns into Right Front Stance facing D: Right Inside Forearm Block
  8. Left Front Snap Kick into
  9. Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  10. Right Middle Punch
  11. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing E: Left Inside Forearm Block
  12. Right Front Snap Kick into
  13. Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  14. Left Middle Punch
  15. Right leg turns into Right Front Stance: Right Hooking Block
  16. Left Hooking Block, pivoting on the ball of the left foot
  17. Right Middle Punch
  18. Left leg steps forward into Left Front Stance: Left Hooking Block
  19. Right Hooking Block, pivoting on the ball of the right foot
  20. Left Middle Punch
  21. Right leg steps forward into Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch, Kihap!
  22. Left leg raises into a Left Flamingo Stance: Guarding Block
  23. Left Side Thrust Kick into a
  24. Left Front Stance: Right Trapping Elbow Strike
  25. Right leg raises into a Right Flamingo Stance toward A: Guarding Block
  26. Right Side Thrust Kick (toward A) into a
  27. Right Front Stance: Left Trapping Elbow Strike
  28. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing G: Open-Hand Box Block
  29. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Augmented Spear Hand Strike
  30. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing H: Open-Hand Box Block
  31. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Augmented Spear Hand Strike
  32. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing A: Left Middle Block
  33. Right Middle Punch
  34. Right leg steps forward into Right Front Stance: Right Middle Block
  35. Left Middle Punch
  36. Left leg jumps forward into a Left X-Stance: Left Back Fist, kihap!
  37. Feet come together. Turn clockwise into a Right Front Stance facing C: Right Augment Block
  38. Right leg steps up to left, left steps out into Left Front Stance facing B: Left Augment Block, kihap!

Name: Joong-Gun
Meaning: Joong-Gun is named after the patriot Ahn Joong-Gun who assassinated Hirobumi Ito, the first Japanese governor-general of Korea, known as the man who played the leading part in the Korea-Japan merger.
Steps:
1. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing B: Left Inside Ridge-Hand Block, kihap!
  2. Left Front Snap Kick
  3. Right leg steps forward into a Right Cat Stance: Upward Palm-Heel Block
  4. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing C: Right Inside Ridge-Hand Block
  5. Right Front Snap Kick
  6. Left leg steps forward into a Left Cat Stance: Upward Palm-Heel Block
  7. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing D: Double Knife-Hand Block
  8. Left leg shifts into a Left Front Stance: Right Upward Elbow Strike
  9. Right leg steps forward into a Right Back Stance: Double Knife-Hand Block
  10. Right leg shifts into a Right Front Stance: Left Upward Elbow Strike
  11. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Double Up
  12. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Double Down, kihap!
  13. Right leg steps slightly left, left turns into a Left Front Stance facing A: Right High X Block
  14. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing E: Left Back Fist
  15. Left leg shifts into a Left Front Stance: Left Outside Wrist Pull
  16. Right High Punch
  17. Left leg steps up to right, right steps out into a Right Back Stance facing F: Right Back Fist
  18. Right leg shifts into a Right Front Stance: Right Outside Wrist Pull
  19. Left High Punch
  20. Right leg steps up to left, left steps out into a Left Front Stance facing A: Left Augment Block
  21. Taekwondo twist into a Left Back Stance: Left Middle Punch
  22. Right Side-Thrust Kick into a
  23. Right Front Stance: Right Augment Block
  24. Taekwondo twist into a Right Back Stance: Right Middle Punch
  25. Left Side-Thrust Kick into a
  26. Left Back Stance: Guarding Block
  27. Left leg shifts into a Left Front Stance: Left Pressing Block
  28. Right leg steps forward into a Right Back Stance: Guarding Block
  29. Right leg shifts into a Right Front Stance: Right Pressing Block
  30. Left leg steps up to right into a Closed Stance facing C: Right Cross-Body Punch (sanchin)
  31. Right leg steps into a Right Back Stance facing C: Staff Block
  32. Right leg steps up to left, left steps out into a Left Back Stance facing B: Staff Block, kihap!

Name: Toi-Gye
Meaning: Toi-Gye is the pen name of the noted scholar Yi Hwang, and authority on Neo-Confucianism
Steps:
1. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing B: Left Inside Forearm Block, kihap!
  2. Left leg shifts into a Left Front Stance: Right Groin Strike
  3. Left leg steps up to right in a Closed Stance facing D: Left Down Block + Right Rear Back Fist
  4. Right leg turns into a Right Back Stance facing C: Right Inside Forearm Block
  5. Right leg shifts into a Right Front Stance: Left Groin Strike
  6. Right leg steps up to left in a Closed Stance facing D: Right Down Block + Left Rear Back Fist
  7. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance facing D: Low X-Block
  8. Double Up
  9. Left Front Snap Kick
  10. Left Middle Punch
  11. Right Middle Punch
  12. Left leg steps up to right into a Closed Stance facing E: Double Side Elbow Strike (sanchin)
  13. Right leg stomps into a Horse Stance on line DE: W-Block
  14. Left leg stomps into a Horse Stance on line DE: W-Block
  15. Left leg stomps into a Horse Stance on Line EF: W-Block
  16. Right leg stomps into a Horse Stance on line DF: W-Block
  17. Left leg stomps into a Horse Stance on line DF: W-Block
  18. Left leg stomps into a Horse Stance on line EF: W-Block
  19. Right leg steps up to left, left steps forward into a Left Back Stance facing D: Left Low Augment Block
  20. Left leg shifts into a Left Front Stance: Double Head Grab
  21. Right Grabbing Forward Knee Strike, kihap!
  22. Right foot steps down next to left, Left turns into a Left Back Stance facing A: Double Knife-Hand Block
  23. Left Front Snap Kick
  24. Taekwondo twist into a Left Front Stance: Left High Spear Hand Strike
  25. Right leg steps forward into a Left Back Stance: Double Knife-Hand Block
  26. Right Front Snap Kick
  27. Taekwondo twist into a Right Front Stance: Right High Spear Hand Strike
  28. Right leg steps back into a Left Back Stance: Left Down Block + Right Rear Back Fist
  29. Jump into a Right X Stance facing A: Low X-Block
  30. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Augment Block
  31. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing B: Low Double Knife-Hand Block
  32. Left leg shifts into a Left Front Stance facing B: Right Inside Forearm Block towards D
  33. Left leg steps up to right, right steps out into a Right Back Stance facing C: Low Double Knife-Hand Block
  34. Right leg shifts into a Right Front Stance facing C: Left Inside Forearm Block towards D
  35. Shift into a Left Front Stance facing B: Right Inside Forearm Block towards D
  36. Shift into a Right Front Stance facing C: Left Inside Forearm Block towards D
  37. Right leg steps into a Horse Stance on line BC: Right Middle Punch, kihap!

Name: Hwa-Rang
Meaning: The Hwarang warriors, or 'Flowering Knights', were an elite group of male youth in Silla, an ancient Korean kingdom during the 9th and 10th centuries.
Steps:
1. Left leg steps out into a Horse Stance on line BF: Left Palm Heel Block, kihap!
  2. Right Middle Punch
  3. Left Middle Punch
  4. Right leg slides back into a Right Back Stance facing B: Box Block
  5. Left Grabbing Upper Cut
  6. Taekwondo twist and slide forward into a Right Fixed Stance: Right Middle Punch
  7. Right leg steps back into a Closed Stance facing C: Vertical Knife-Hand Strike towards A
  8. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance facing B: Left Middle Punch
  9. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing C: Left Down Block
  10. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  11. Left foot steps up to right into a Right Natural Stance: Left Hand Trap
  12. Right Side-Thrust Kick (pulling hands to left side) into a Right Back Stance: Right Reverse Knife-Hand Strike
  13. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  14. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch, kihap!
  15. Left leg turns into a Left Back Stance facing D: Double Knife-Hand Block
  16. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Augmented Spear-Hand Strike
  17. About-face into a Left Back Stance facing E: Double Knife-Hand Block
  18. Right Roundhouse Kick (45° Right)
  19. Left Roundhouse Kick (45° Left) into a Left Back Stance facing E: Double Knife-Hand Block
  20. Left leg turns into a Left Front Stance facing A: Left Down Block
  21. Left leg shifts into a Left Back Stance: Right Cross-Body Punch
  22. Right leg steps forward into a Right Back Stance: Left Cross-Body Punch
  23. Left leg steps forward into a Left Back Stance: Right Cross-Body Punch
  24. Left leg shifts into a Left Front Stance: Right Low X Block
  25. Right leg slides forward (towards A) into a Left Back Stance facing C: Right Rear Elbow Strike towards A
  26. Left foot steps up to right (turning counter-clockwise) into a Closed Stance facing F: Right Inside Forearm Block + Left Down Block
  27. Left Inside Forearm Block + Right Down Block
  28. Left foot steps forward into a Left Back Stance facing F: Double Knife-Hand Block
  29. Left foot steps up to right, right steps out into a Right Back Stance facing B: Double Knife-Hand Block, kihap!

Name: Hikō-Ryū no Kon
Meaning: 'Hiko-Ryu' is Japanese for 'Flying Dragons' - referring to students of Royal West Martial Arts
Junbi: From Closed Bowing Position, switch bo to Closed Ready Stance
Steps:
1. Left foot steps out into a Parallel Horse Stance facing forward: Parallel Rising Block
  2. Parallel Down Block
  3. Left leg turns into a Left Forward Stance facing B: Left Forward Strike (wing), kihap!
  4. Left leg shifts into a Left Back Stance: Box Block
  5. Right leg crosses in front of left, left steps out into a Left Forward Stance: Left Throat Spear (wing)
  6. Right Forward Strike (wing) to the Knee
  7. Left Forward Strike (wing) to the Ribs
  8. R Forward Strike (wing) to the temple
  9. About-face into a Right Forward Stance facing A: Right Throat Spear (wing)
  10. Left leg steps forward into a Left Forward Stance: Left Throat Spear (wing)

    11. Theroy of the Wepon

  11. Right Clavical Strike (Tucking)
  12. Left Throat Spear (wing)
  13. Right Groin Strike
  14. Left Throat Spear (wing)
  15. Left Forward Strike (wing)
  16. Right Forward Strike (wing)
  17. Left Forward Strike (wing)
  18. Switch hands to south-paw position. Right leg turns into a Right Forward Stance facing C: Right Forward Strike (wing), kihap!
  19. Right leg shifts into a Right Back Stance: Box Block
  20. Left leg crosses in front of right, right steps out into a Right Forward Stance: Right Throat Spear (wing)
  21. Left Forward Strike (wing) to the knee
  22. Right Forward Strike (wing) to the Ribs
  23. Left Forward Strike (wing) to the temple
  24. About-face into a Left Forward Stance facing D: Left Throat Spear (wing)
  25. Left leg shifts into a Left Cat Stance: Left Hooking Block
  26. Left leg steps forward into a Left Forward Stance: Left Throat Spear (wing)
  27. Shift into a Left Aft Stance: Box Block
  28. Right leg steps forward into a Right Walking Stance: Right Figure-8 to the Left (continuing into)
  29. Right Figure-8 to the Right (continuing into)
  30. Right Figure-8 to the Left. Catch the bo with your left hand (continuing into)
  31. Left leg steps forward into a Left Walking Stance: Left Figure-8 to the right (continuing into)
  32. Left Figure-8 to the left (continuing into)
  33. Left figure-8 to the right. Catch the bo with your right hand. Switch left hand to south-paw
  34. Right leg steps forward into a Right Forward Stance: Left Throat Spear (wing)
  35. Release the left hand and step forward into a Left Forward Stance, chambering the bo behind your head. Left hand grabs the butt of the bo (forming a left orthodox position): Forward Strike (wing) to the Knee, kihap!
  36. Slide the right hand into an orthodox position. Right leg rises into a Right Flamingo Stance facing E: Box Block
  37. Slide the right hand into the middle of the bo. Release left hand. Right leg steps down into a Right Back Stance towards B: Execute 'Flight of the Dragon - Part 1' continuing into...
  38. Left leg steps frward into a parallel closed Stance facing A: Execute 'Flight of the Dragon - Part 2' continuing into...
  39. Right leg turns clockwise into a Right Back Stance facing E: Execute 'Flight of the Dragon - Part 3' continuing into...
  40. 'Flight of the Dragon - Part 4'
  41. Left leg steps forward into a Left Forward Stance. Chamber the bo behind the right tricep (the left hand catches the bo under the right armpit)
  42. Release the right hand. Rotate the bo clockwise until horizontal. Right hand catches the bo at pistol position (palm down). Change left hand to form a south-paw position: Left Throat Spear (wing)
  43. Right foot sweep into
  44. Right forward strike (pistol)
  45. Left sliding front snap kick
  46. Lower left foot. Right leg steps forward into a Right Walking Stance. Left foot steps behind right into a Right X-Stance: Right Throat Spear (wing) towards E, kihap!
  47. Left leg rises into a Left Flamingo Stance facing D: Box Block
  48. Left leg steps down into a Left Forward Stance facing A: Parallel Rising Block
  49. Switch hands to orthodox position: Right leg steps forward into a Right Forward Stance: Right Down Block (Tucking)
  50. Left leg steps forward into a Left Forward Stance. Bring bo above head. Switch right hand, release left hand. Rotate bo C.W. 180-degrees. Left hand catches bo (crossing in front of right arm). Continue clockwise rotation. Switching right hand, then left, forming a south-paw position. Left Down Block (tucking)
  51. Right leg steps up to lef: chambering the bo on the right side. Left steps out into a Left Kneeling Stance: Left Throat Spear (wing)
  52. Right foot sweep into
  53. Right forward strike (wing) to the ground, kihap!
  54. Left leg steps into a Parallel Horse Stance facing forward: Parallel Rising Block
  55. Parallel Down Block

Name: Nishiō
Meaning: Nishiō is a Japanese translation of the name Royal West, founder and Grandmaster of Royal West Martial Arts
Steps:
1. Right leg steps back into a Left Front Stance facing C: Left Middle Block, kihap!
  2. Left leg steps back into a Right Front Stance: Right High Palm Heel Block
  3. Left Outside Crescent Kick
  4. Right Roundhouse Kick
  5. Left Turning Side-Thrust Kick into
  6. Left Fixed Stance facing C: Left Reverse Knife-Hand Strike
  7. Right leg drops into a Left Kneeling Stance: Left Open-Hand Rising Block + Right Upper Cut, kihap!
  8. Right Grabbing Elbow Strike
  9. Head Grab Throw to the right
  10. About face into all fours facing B: Right Back Kick towards A
  11. Stand up into a Left Back Stance facing B: Double Palm Heel Pushing Block
  12. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Left Low X Block
  13. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Right High X Block
  14. Left leg steps back into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Block
  15. Right leg steps back into a Left Front Stance: Left High Palm Heel Strike
  16. Right Outside Crescent Kick
  17. Left Roundhouse Kick
  18. Right Turning Side-Thrust Kick into
  19. Right Fixed Stance: Right Reverse Knife-Hand Strike
  20. Left leg drops into a Right Kneeling Stance: Right Open-Hand Rising Block + Left Upper Cut, kihap!
  21. Left Grabbing Elbow Strike
  22. Head Grab Throw to the left
  23. About face onto all fours facing C: Left Back Kick Towards B
  24. Stand up into a Right Back Stance facing C: Double Palm Heel Pushing Block
  25. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Right Low X Block
  26. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Left High X Block
  27. Left Inside Twist Kick into
  28. Left Front Stance: Left High Punch
  29. Right Middle Punch, kihap!

Name: Won-Hyo
Meaning: Wonhyo was the noted monk who introduced Buddhism to the Silla Dynasty in the year 686 AD

Name: Won-Hyo
Meaning: Wonhyo was the noted monk who introduced Buddhism to the Silla Dynasty in the year 686 AD

Name: Saju Jirugi
Steps:
1. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch, Kihap!
  2. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance facing C: Left Down Block
  3. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  4. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance facing D: Left Down Block
  5. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch
  6. Right leg shifts into a Left Front Stance facing E: Left Down Block
  7. Right leg steps forward into a Right Front Stance: Right Middle Punch, Kihap!
  8. Right leg returns to Parallel Ready Stance facing B.
  9. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch, Kihap!
  10. Left leg shifts into a Right Front Stance facing E: Right Down Block
  11. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  12. Left leg shifts into a Right Front Stance facing D: Right Down Block
  13. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch
  14. Left shifts into a Right Front Stance facing C: Right Down Block
  15. Left leg steps forward into a Left Front Stance: Left Middle Punch, Kihap!
